Structural Equation Modelling

Source: vignettes/articles/sem.qmd 
library(INLAvaan)
# The industrialization and Political Democracy Example from Bollen (1989), page
# 332
model <- "
  # Latent variable definitions
     ind60 =~ x1 + x2 + x3
     dem60 =~ y1 + a*y2 + b*y3 + c*y4
     dem65 =~ y5 + a*y6 + b*y7 + c*y8

  # (Latent) regressions
    dem60 ~ ind60
    dem65 ~ ind60 + dem60

  # Residual correlations
    y1 ~~ y5
    y2 ~~ y4 + y6
    y3 ~~ y7
    y4 ~~ y8
    y6 ~~ y8
"
utils::data("PoliticalDemocracy", package = "lavaan")

fit <- asem(model, PoliticalDemocracy, test = "none")
#> ℹ Using MVN log-likelihood.
#> ℹ Finding posterior mode.
#> ✔ Finding posterior mode. [239ms]
#> 
#> ℹ Computing the Hessian.
#> ✔ Computing the Hessian. [666ms]
#> 
#> ℹ Performing VB correction.
#> ✔ Performing VB correction. [596ms]
#> 
#> ℹ Using skew normal approximation.
#> ⠙ Fitting skew normal to 0/28 marginals.
#> ⠹ Fitting skew normal to 20/28 marginals.
#> ✔ Fitting skew normal to 28/28 marginals. [3.8s]
#> 
#> ℹ Sampling covariances and defined parameters.
#> ✔ Sampling covariances and defined parameters. [361ms]
#> 
summary(fit)
